intro: Dimeria solitaria, commonly known as the solitary dimeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or purple and are pollinated by insects. Dimeria solitaria is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush habitats.
